Module paths
Package edu.ntnu.idatt2001.paths.models

Class Game

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idatt2001.paths.models.Game
public class Game extends Object
A class that represents a game. A game connects a player to a story and have methods to start and manage the game. It has a player, a story and a list of goals and represent what the user will use. The game have goals that the player must fulfill to win the game.
Version:
1.1 - 19.05.2023
Author:
Helle R. and Sander S.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(Player player, Story story, List<Goal> goals, Passage currentPassage) throws NullPointerException
      Constructor for Game. The player, story and goals can not be null.
      Parameters:
      player - The player of the game - represents who is playing the game and their possessions
      story - The story of the game - represents the structure of the game with links and passages
      goals - The goals of the game - the achievements that the player must fulfill to win
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if player, story or goals is null.

    • begin

      public Passage begin()
      Starts the game and returns the opening passage of the story.
      Returns:
      The opening passage of the story.

    • go

      public Passage go(Link link) throws NullPointerException
      Returns the passage that is linked to the given link and moves the player to the new passage through the link. If the player has fulfilled any of the goals, the ending passage is returned.
      Parameters:
      link - The link to the passage.
      Returns:
      The passage that is linked to by the given link or the ending passage if the player has fulfilled any of the goals.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if link is null.

    • checkGoals

      public boolean checkGoals()
      Checks if the player has fulfilled all the goals.
      Returns:
      True if the player has fulfilled all the goals, false otherwise.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the game.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the game.
